title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must include two different scales to earn two points.
descriptions: The response does not indicate any of the following scales on which biodiversity can be measured.
The response indicates one of the following scales on which biodiversity can be measured.
The response indicates two of the following scales on which biodiversity can be measured.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not refer to the diagram when explaining that Community B is more diverse than Community A because Community B has a higher species evenness than Community A.
The response refers to the diagram when describing that Community B is more diverse than Community A because Community B has a higher species evenness than Community A.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must describe, not just identify, the regulating service provided by a community shown in the figure. The regulating service must be a service provided by a forest ecosystem.
descriptions: The response does not describe a regulating service provided by a community shown in the figure, such as:
The response describes one regulating service provided by a community shown in the figure, such as:

title: Part (d)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, the control group in the experiment.
descriptions: The response does not describe the control group as an unburned area that has no fire intensity/a fire intensity of zero that can be used as a comparison for the baseline amount of biodiversity.
The response describes the control group as an unburned area that has no fire intensity/a fire intensity of zero that can be used as a comparison for the baseline amount of biodiversity.

title: Part (d)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state a likely original hypothesis for the study, such as:
The response states a likely original hypothesis for the study, such as:
